intro: Sida inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, usually pink or purple flowers. Its leaves are alternate and often have a rough texture. Sida inaequalis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in coastal areas.
